Abstract: This study explores the intricate dynamics between social movements, power structures, and mediated visibility in the digital age. Focusing on the role of visual media, it examines how social movements navigate the complex interplay of states and corporations to amplify their messages and mobilize support. The research highlights the transformative impact of technology on visibility strategies, revealing both opportunities and challenges for activists. Through a critical analysis of case studies, it sheds light on the evolving landscape of power and resistance, offering insights into the mechanisms through which social movements leverage mediated visibility to challenge dominant narratives and effect social change.
